title: SS ER 5: Ethics, science, and public funds
prompt:
You should plan to spend 25 minutes reading, writing, and editing your response.

In your response, develop an argument about how George W. Bush’s speech reflects the enduring issue expressed in the quote from Albert Einstein.

To support your analysis, be sure to incorporate relevant evidence from the two passages and your own knowledge of the circumstances surrounding Bush's decision on stem cell research.
feedback:
Our team of teachers will grade your Extended Response within 72 hours. Please check back for detailed feedback on your response.

An enduring social issue addressed in Albert Einstein’s quote and George W. Bush’s speech is ethics, science, and government funding. An excellent response will correctly cite evidence from the speech, the quote, and additional historical evidence to make an argument about science and ethics or related political issues. Relevant historical evidence might include experiments in Nazi concentration camps, the Tuskegee syphilis study, or human cloning.

An excellent response will not summarize the passages, but instead use the provided information to take a stand on the enduring social issue. The response will support the position using multiple examples. The main idea will be clearly introduced at the beginning, and also restated at the end.

Finally, an excellent response will be long enough to demonstrate the test taker can consistently use standard English writing conventions. It may not be perfect, but will have an acceptable number of errors for on-demand writing. The response will include a variety of precise words and a variety of sentence structures, including transition words that make the response easy to follow.
